1.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)
to veil from sight, i.e. conceal (literally or figuratively)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:

2.brief: arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to manipulate, i.e. seize; chiefly to capture, wield, specifically, to overlay; figuratively, to use unwarrantably
a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a longing; by implication, a delight (subjectively, satisfaction, objectively, a charm)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

4.brief: morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)

5.brief: properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff

6.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

7.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol

8.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls)
properly, a concealer, i.e. a covert
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk

9.brief: properly, a concealer, i.e. a covert
a hut (as of entwined boughs); also a lair
to clutch; hence, to seize as aprisoner
to clutch; hence, to seize as aprisoner
to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)

10.brief: to sink or depress (reflexive or causative)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
powerful (specifically, a paw); by implication, numerous

11.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)

12.brief: to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention

13.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship

14.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to surround, i.e. protect or aid

15.brief: the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
properly, to tread or frequent; usually to follow (for pursuit or search); by implication, to seek or ask; specifically to worship
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

16.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

17.brief: a longing; by implication, a delight (subjectively, satisfaction, objectively, a charm)
depressed (figuratively), in mind (gentle) or circumstances (needy, especially saintly)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

18.brief: to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
to awe or (intransitive) to dread; hence, to harass
a man in general (singly or collectively)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
